The TSAN thread leak thing is real and it's a problem. The source is that right now threads are only being harvested at shutdown, but that application calls exit which doesn't actually trigger a shutdown. I thought about using `atexit` but it's complicated because there's no guarantee of if `atexit` handlers are called before or after the thread really dies. I'm looking to see if there's another option.

@kpayson64 : The latest commit (5e1298f) does some 2-phase synchronization to join poll-cv threads cleanly without any thread leaks on early exit.

The remaining failures are unrelated.

Not only is the PR green, I also ran tsan tests of the previous thread leaks 500x on my desktop and got no failures, even with multiple antagonists. I think this works.
